scenarios.title: Speaking Up Against Misbehavior
scenarios.context: You notice a group of boys making inappropriate comments towards female classmates
scenarios.initialPrompt: How would you approach this situation and speak up against this behavior?
suggestedResponses: Excuse me, I don't think those comments are appropriate or respectful.
I'm not comfortable with the way you're talking about our classmates.
That kind of behavior isn't okay. How would you feel if someone spoke that way about your sister or friend?
tips: Use a firm but non-aggressive tone
Focus on the behavior, not the person
Seek support from others if needed

scenarios.title: Initiating a Casual Conversation
scenarios.context: You're sitting next to someone new in class/work
scenarios.initialPrompt: How would you start a conversation with your new seatmate?
suggestedResponses: Hi, I don't think we've met before. I'm [name].
That's an interesting book/laptop sticker. Are you into [related topic]?
How are you finding the class/work so far?
tips: Notice something about them that could be a conversation starter
Show genuine interest in their responses

scenarios.title: Handling Social Anxiety in Group Settings
scenarios.context: You're in a team meeting and need to share your ideas
scenarios.initialPrompt: How would you contribute your ideas in a group setting?
suggestedResponses: I've been thinking about this, and I have an idea I'd like to share...
Building on what [previous speaker] said, I think we could also consider...
From my perspective, one approach could be...
tips: Remember that your input is valuable
